website_summaries.verdict: A rack that ranks at the top of its class for keeping your bikes secure while traveling.
pros: Keeps bikes from rubbing against each other or car
Able to keep bikes locked in place and simply tilt them away to access the rear of your vehicle

customer_reviews.title: Cable locks are worthless
customer_reviews.text: At first glance seem to be well-designed. That is until I tried to pull the cable lock out to discover that it is barely held on with a flimsy plastic Tab and at the first pull the entire thing broke off. More importantly the cable itself is not truly connected to anything substantial. Total cosmetic and a waste for security sake we will not be using it.
customer_reviews.author: spratel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with several of the "hanging" style hitch-mount bike racks which really don't fit our cruiser bikes very well at all, we finally invested in the flatbed-style T2 Pro XT -- and what a difference it makes! This rack is absolutely rock-solid when attached to the hitch and the bikes mount easily and quickly. The rack is expensive, no question -- but after owning it for a couple of months now (and it's gotten heavy use) we are totally thrilled with it. One note: the rack is *heavy* -- my wife (who is very fit, but not all that strong) really struggles to get it on and off of the car hitch by herself.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Good product but assembly instructions provided are poor
customer_reviews.text: I put it together today and looks like it is well build and looking forward to using it. The assembly instructions are horrible. It is a simple document with hand drawings and no written details at all. Important information such as using the dummy key provided to install the lock cores is missing. There is also no assembly video provided on line. I would think that considering the cost of these units THULE would invest in a real assembly instruction document or video.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out, sturdy design.
customer_reviews.text: Took moderate patience to assemble. Instructions were nearly useless so resorted to a YouTube vid. I have a Jeep Wrangler with large off-road spare tire so was worried it would not lock into place in the upright position to store but it just barely fit. Very happy with this bike rack. One note in the secure cable that comes with it, I would not rely on this other than perhaps running into a store or somewhere real quick. If leaving overnight, I’d recommend bringing bikes inside or buying a more substantial locking system.
customer_reviews.author: IrishHippie

customer_reviews.title: Revised:  I like this rack, with reservations
customer_reviews.text: I gave this three stars before but I'm revising to four after having used it a bit. The biggest issue I've had was that there was something "broken" when I got it -- meaning the little pin that connects the handle to the mechanism. I didn't find this until I'd put it together so I had to take it apart to fix it. Also, the integrated lock only works on narrow tires and even then is only for locking your front wheel to the rack. But after taking this on several trips I do like the way it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A

customer_reviews.title: Very secure.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up and bikes are very secure. Am using this for two ebikes and it handles the weight easily. I would not leave the bikes on the rack overnight if I were staying in a motel as the included cable locks appear as though they’d be easy to defeat, so I would look at a more secure and robust system if I needed to leave the bikes unattended. The only other thing is that the unit is quite heavy but then again I suppose that accounts for it’s sturdiness. I am very satisfied with this unit and really like the fact that no part of the system comes in contact with the painted parts of the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: william smith

customer_reviews.title: Top quality travel accessory
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Strong enough to accommodate my two 58lb e-bikes. I'm still trying to find the right bike covers to protect the bikes in bad weather but that is separate from the function of this carrier. It's heavy but that's to be expected for something can carry 120lbs cantilevered off a trailer hitch. It's best to use two people to assemble it, attach it to the hitch and mount the bikes. It can be done by one person but it's tough. Love the functionality. Fold up when not in use and tilt down so you can access your hatch back. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control and Support
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to assemble the unit I found one tray was not tapped so I had to buy a tap and tap the threads before I could put it together. Tried Warranty support and could not reach anyone (no callback option), customer Support was no help, said could not transfer. Wrote a letter but have not heard back. Package also contains a mystery key?
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Haltiwanger

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I just opened and put this together unfortunately three months after I bought it. It is defective. The bottom knob won’t tighten into the hitch, it just spins without tightening. So the whole rack wobbles too much to be usable. Beware, open immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, capable
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, capable, and so, so easy to use. This Thule hitch is easy to mount in my 2” hitch, and there it securely remains whether one or two bicycles are mounted. Whether at 25 mph or at 65 mph. Whether on smooth paved roads or on bumpy back-country roads. This is by far easier than a roof-mount system. It also does not tax your fuel mileage. Five stars. Unquestionably.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality and super expensive
customer_reviews.text: 7 months after with very little use, the bike strap broke. No fixing. Choose a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando M

customer_reviews.title: The best rack for High Value Bikes
customer_reviews.text: If you want to rack your high value bike for a road trip, this is the only way to roll. Protected from swinging around and banging other bikes or the vehicle. Your headset does not get the crap beat out of it flopping with a wheel getting wind battered. The bike is out of the wind and not getting pelted by road rocks, sand etc. Expensive but very sturdy, secure and less costly than your bike!
customer_reviews.author: NLU

customer_reviews.title: fully satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the cheapest bike rack you will find, but you get great quality. I find this to be very sturdy, easy to use and overall a great purchase. Put this in the category of pay once, cry once. You'll never have to replace this and will get enjoyment from using it because it is so well made. The security cable is good but basic and I think you'd want something more substantial if you were leaving the bikes unaccompanied for a long period of time (overnight at a hotel, for example).
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I love this. We've carried both our bikes across county ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this. We've carried both our bikes across county with no issues. This thing was easy to put together (I did it myself in 10 min), super easy to put on/off the hitch, love the lock mechanism....the only downside is that its heavy (and I mean heavy!) But its incredibly sturdy and I wouldn't trade it for a different model. Love the option to extend it with an add-on for two additional bikes. Will come in handy when our daughter is older and we have to bring her bike on trips too.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great for our RV and traveling
customer_reviews.text: We full time RV and this bike rack works great for us. Easy to install and holds the bike secure while traveling down the road. I only wish it had a few optional holes to install it into my receiver so I could either move in or out from the back of the RV. We have no problem putting bikes on or off the rack. I can even take mine off and on the inside while leaving the outside bike alone. Wife likes the tilt when she gets her bike off the end.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Best rack you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: These are not cheap in any sense of the word but you get what you pay for. Super easy to put together. Super easy to put on the hitch or remove. Putting bikes on it is simple and they are SECURE. Totally no worries about anything falling off in transit. The only thing to worry about is that the bikes will stick out a bit so remember you put them on. The tilt mechanism is great. I can tilt the bikes back enough so that I can put down the tailgate of my truck completely without having to remove the bikes or the rack to access the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Stan R.

customer_reviews.title: Guessing it's the last bike rack we'll ever need to buy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It's heavy and quite large, and I'm small, so it's not something I can move easily without help. But it goes on/in the hitch very easily and is very easy to operate. The anti-bounce system is great. After researching many bike racks and narrowing them down to the comparable Yakima and this one, we chose this one. It's not cheap. But it's a good example of you get what you pay for. Thule makes quality products. I anticipate that, taking off the car when not in use, it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Q

customer_reviews.title: Was excited now mad.
customer_reviews.text: Bolt holes not threaded on second bike carrier. Returning to amazon for a replacement. Thule customer service couldn’t be less helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bike racks
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took less than 1 hour. Instructions are more than sufficient. Assembled rack is very solid and looks awesome. Pros: handle to move it up or down. It helps a lot and its very convenient feature. Rack can hold any types of tires. And locks are really sturdy and keeps everything at place even on bumpy roads. Cons: same handle:) Pro has main drawback as many pointed. Once it’s transformed into 4 bike rack you’d rather avoid removing such extension. Non pro version is easier for constant transformations. But personally I’m totally fine with that.
customer_reviews.author: Maksym

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike rack. I am deleting one star because of the built-in lean that many others complain about. This bike rack is so easy to use! What sold me was the hitch lock design. Now if only they could design one made of aluminum or titanium. I dread lugging this bike rack up the attic ladder for the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Otisbud

customer_reviews.title: Love it, The quality is better than the t2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it, The quality is better than the t2 classic. It has cool locking handle that tightens the rack so it does not shake and the locking cable is an extra bonus for security. I am using this with the CURT 45792 Dual Receiver Extender for my 2017 wrangler unlimited and have no problem opening the tailgate. The trick is to reverse mount the Curt dual receiver where the secondary receiver is on the lower side. That is where the rack goes in. Then you hit the lever to drop the rack at an angle and the tailgate opens all the way. Of course you have to take all the bikes of the rack to open all the way.
customer_reviews.author: parkale

customer_reviews.title: J...U...N...K...!
customer_reviews.text: rack has stiff cables and there very short-the locks are junk broke first use-further the two rails weren't even drilled and tapped- the maim hitch lock is worthless - poor locks poor quality control- i don't recommend-very expensive china quality buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tackney

customer_reviews.title: Good rack for a heavy e-bike
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this appears to be nice, well made rack, designed to transport heavy bikes. I bought it to haul my Rad e- bike which is very heavy bike with a 4 inch fat tire. The Amazon description says this rack is compatible with fat tires up to 5 inches. The rack will accommodate fat tires by relocating the rear wheel strap to the fastening point on the back of the rear wheel holder.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: This rack can be stolen off of your car
customer_reviews.text: The rack function and design for bikes is fine. But the design of the hitch mount is flawed. There is no locking pin once the hitch mount is inside the receiver. It tightens up providing the anti-wobble feature and “secure” it but the rack can be pulled out of the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: While there are some cheaper (still good) options out there, the T2 Pro XT2 for me has been bombproof thus far. I often drive 2+ hrs into the mountains to Colorado bike parks in the summer with a downhill bike and an enduro bike. Even on some rough terrain on the way to the campsites after a day of riding everything stays solidly put. The built-in locks on each arm, alongside the main lock to secure the rack to my Jeep are great. I would say definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Goodland

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions good
customer_reviews.text: My initial impressions of this product are good. I found it to be reasonably easy to install with the only down point being the lack of installation instructions. On line private videos were very helpful and the install was not bad. Use of the product is so much easier than my previous bike racks so I am very pleased about that. My box was complete with all needed parts and hardware and received in good condition. I have used it once after receiving it so still a little early to comment on quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: No contact with frames, holds bikes great without chance of rubbing against each other. Able to tilt away with bikes in place to access rear of vehicle. Fits road bikes and mountain bikes without any issues. Only issue was with assembly, did not come with 2 of the holes drilled as they should have been. I am fortunate enough to have equipment to drill these put otherwise would have returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The rack is well built and attaches solidly. Plus, the bikes don't move around once attached. As others noted it is heavy, which can make it a little awkward to attach. But, I suppose the extra weight is the result of the quality of the build and is part of what makes it feel so solid. The reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is that the assembly instructions are horrible. Plan on using google to find help with assembly if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Quality and very happy!
customer_reviews.text: A+ worth the price for this quality. I drove 3000 miles across the country and my bikes didn’t move! Got my trailer hitch from U-Haul. I love that it comes with a pull out cable lock. It’s not very long but it works and gave me piece of mind when parking at random towns and hotels. It’s super fast to put bikes on and off!
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item after we had purchased my wife's bike; Since we had 2 bikes, it was smart to get some kind of trailer for it. I've seen this one on the road many times and have seen it perform first hand very well. Thought the road vibration will make it shake a little the wheel holders for the front and back wheels are easily able to be tightened for a better security of the bike while traveling. There is also a security lock which seems like it will deter thieves but I wouldnt keep your bike outside overnight locked onto this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jun

customer_reviews.title: Pass if you have 5 inch tires
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to move the phantom E9 electric bike which has 5 inch tires. The back security strap for the back tire is at least 1 inch short. Awaiting an email back from customer support he’s only open M to F. Still can’t understand how the rack that is advertised for 5 inch tire is so short on the strap....
customer_reviews.author: Always Summer Here

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy, dependable, cherry
customer_reviews.text: I load this thing up. 2 mountain bikes complete with packed panniers, gear strapped on and all. Bugga is cherry. Youtube the model and watch a guy help you assemble it for no errors. Be sure to tighten all screws after 100 miles or so as they initially get a bit loose. Would buy again, we use all features of this rack and I use it to sit on and hold my gear too.
customer_reviews.author: Hapakings808

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Stiffness, easy to use; with a lock; simply great, fits tires up to 5”
customer_reviews.text: Spent sometimes to look at bike racks, finally selected this one, and bought it used/Good condition from Amazon - Rackattack; it was packed in the original box, the packing was damaged, the rack arrived in perfect condition. Easy to assemble, the instructions are minimum, rather go on “Youtube”, there are many videos explaining how to assemble it, how to adjust it and all its features.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike rack. Bikes are held very securely on the rack. They do not even move on rough roads. Rack mounts solidly in the receiver,no play at all. Only negative-wish locking cable was 4 to 6 inches longer. It works but would be nice to go through frame and wheel at same time. Holds my two mountain bikes nicely and is so easy to use. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S.Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Great bike carrier
customer_reviews.text: Really strong and very little motion on the back of our motorhome. I wanted one that could handle the increase in motion from being on an RV (Distance from rear wheel to hitch). Plus it's easy to put the bikes on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Grant E.

customer_reviews.title: Mistakes made in manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: If the bike rack had arrived undamaged and with all the bolt holes drilled properly it's at least a 4/5. Unfortunately, my $500 rack arrived without threads in the bolt holes of one support rack. I did not have time to deal with shipping back and getting a new one, so I had to tap my own threads. Pretty significant mistake for a $500 part.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer 2

customer_reviews.title: Fat Tire Frustration
customer_reviews.text: The strap does not fit a fat tire bicycle The assembly instructions were awful. Specifically How to assemble the locks. I found a good assembly video on You Tube
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between this rack and spending more to get the highly recommended 1Up. Overall satisfied with this rack, although the cable locks are almost worthless for my full suspension mountain bike. Too short to wrap through the frame, so basically you're just locking the front tire.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to assemble and install. Once it's installed it is super sturdy - no wobbles at all. I carried two bikes on a 1000-mile road trip without any problem. Nothing to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Runningnose

customer_reviews.title: I love using this bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack is sturdy and secure. It's incredibly easy to use. And I love the built-in cable security. Like that it folds up and out of the way when not in use and fold down so we can access our tailgate without having to take the rack off. It is definitely a heavy rack. The way it is designed though makes it easy for me to put the bikes on and to fold it up after taking the bikes off.
customer_reviews.author: KerAn

customer_reviews.title: E-Bike
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have E-Bikes. E-Bikes weigh anywhere from 48-55 lbs. This carrier handles them with ease. Very secure!
customer_reviews.author: K-

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous bike rack. Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love love this bike rack. Makes it so easy to load up and go. Check out YouTube video for easy instructions. The ones that come with it aren’t good.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Best rack in its class
customer_reviews.text: This is the best rack I've seen. Very sturdy and well made. Bikes don't move at all and can fit fatty and even fat bikes with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Jaimes

customer_reviews.title: Not secured
customer_reviews.text: It is a great bike rack. Solid and easy to install and operate but the rack attach to the hitch is secured by tool less knob not a pinch hole. If somehow the mechanism of the hitch knob is malfunction, then the rack will be detached . There is a pinch needle on the side which can be hooked in the existing pinch hole but not secure enough. If they take out this side pinch, you can push the rack close the bumper when the rack is not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Did anyone mention this is a heavy duty bike rack? Installation took a bit longer than anticipated and directions are nearly worthless. Once installed and you learn the tricks it is a great rack but takes some effort to attach and remove it from the vehicle as it is pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Teodoro

customer_reviews.title: Best Option Ever
customer_reviews.text: We love this rack. Best decision of what to get to carry our bikes and we can still get the hatch of our Terrain open and the plus we can use it on both vehicles (truck) and never worry about not having room when we go kayaking or camping. You can’t go wrong with the ease of use and assembly was a breeze took us less than an hr in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Pottruff

customer_reviews.title: Good rack
customer_reviews.text: Good rack. Has some parts made of plastic which I would have preferred in metal, but overall a good product. Can be placed or removed onto the hitch easily. Two bikes fit securely and have a small cable lock integrated, but not enough to keep the bikes secure. Would have to add a longer cable to fit around the back wheels also.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: The security cable is way short
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like it. It fits my mtn bike and tri bike easily. Two mtn bikes is no problem. No issues with installation or use. The extendable security cable is simply too short. It will wrap around the fork and that’s it. Not long enough to go through the frame or even the wheel itself. For security I have been turning the bike around to wrap the cable through the rear seat stay when I’m away from the car. I turn it around the right way when driving.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hambalek

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack!
customer_reviews.text: It was my mistake not to catch that this rack is not ideal for bikes with fenders. I did return it and was refunded quickly. Overall, expensive bike racks are good, just be sure you know your needs!
customer_reviews.author: Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Most expensive mistake
customer_reviews.text: Do Not buy for ebike. Weight limit is false. Bike slid off three times. Terrible design. The last time, the $2,300 bike tumbled down the road. Wasted money on bike and destroyed bike. Call Thule and expect to stay on endless hold.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Best bike rack ever
customer_reviews.text: After watching several YouTube reviews, I decided on this one. No regrets. Best rack I’ve ever used. Very easy to assemble, easy to use and secures our road bikes very well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Edward I Zwilling

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but not light. Doesn’t wiggle or shake either once installed. So far no issues using.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Primarily for use on class c motor home. It is well made and sturdy. Bikes come on and off easily, but it is heavy, making it a little cumbersome to get into the hitch receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Carl G.

customer_reviews.title: quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: It was extremely sturdy easy to install. I checked out the reviews and the various sellers and compare prices. Thule is hard to beat . Amazon gave me a Quick delivery. I'll be back for more shopping.
customer_reviews.author: thomas lippert

customer_reviews.title: A great rack.
customer_reviews.text: Other than the price, this rack is outstanding. Easy to use, holds the bikes very securely and accommodates every size tire I've tried to load ranging from my road bike, 27.5+ mountain bike and my neighbor's fattie.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy 007

customer_reviews.title: "No Worries" Bike Rack!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few racks before ... all with complications and gaps in my ability to secure the bike(s) to the vehicle. This rack ... Thule 2 ... is the best by far. It is easy to store ... easy to load ... secured by lock/key mount so that I don't have to disengage the rack every time I park. I loads the bikes in minutes with little extra strapping necessary. When I drive I literally never think about looking to see if "they're still there!"
customer_reviews.author: Tom McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but very sturdy., Easy to use and bikes seem secure. Only issue is that it is very heavy to lift to put on hitch. We just leave it on as easy to drop down to access the back of the SUV
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack was easy to install and is really easy to put on and take off bikes. We are really happy with it and haven’t had any issues. It’s expensive but you get what you pay for and this was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective unit. Hopefully it’s fixed by Thule
customer_reviews.text: The rack is great except I can not use one of the platforms because the holes to mount it are not threaded to accept the bolts. Will update the review if this is handled well by Thule. I’d much rather they just send me a platform than have to figure out how to return this to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Zingarelli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack is bullet proof! Heavy duty, sturdy, makes your bike feel super secure. This ain’t your junior light rack, this is built to last, love it!
customer_reviews.author: James77

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely quality made
customer_reviews.text: At first I was somewhat hesitant to spend as much on a bike carrier...especially when the 2-bike carrier cost as much as the two bikes it'll be carrying. However, once I put it together, I couldn't imagine buying anything else. I love quality and this bike carrier has it...in spades!
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: This is one great product and Rack Attack Portland is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product, Rack Attack on SW Morrison St. in Portland, OR. was the shipper and I can't say enough about their on-time shipment and description of this product. I needed this quality rack for a couple Pedego electric bikes (60 lbs ea.) and the product performs perfectly. Thanks Rack Attack for your excellent service on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack
customer_reviews.text: Great product and happy to have it. Unfortunately missing a parts bag. Getting a hold of Thule support (email , phone) has been a real challenge. Hope to hear from them soon
customer_reviews.author: Jason Burden

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and fits snuggly into receiver
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and fits snuggly into receiver. Installation took me a bit longer than expected as I couldn't decipher exactly what the picture instructions were telling me to do but once I figured it out, not too bad. Product itself is excellent. Fits wifes 27.5 and my 29 easily. Nice product
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Page

customer_reviews.title: It gets great reviews for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike rack. I always transported my bikes on a roof rack, but my new car is a SUV And it is a bit too high. I feel more comfortable with my bike on this rack, very secure and easy to onload and offload. The locking system is great, and it folds up nicely when not is use, it tilts perfectly to enable access to the back hatch.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Griffin

customer_reviews.title: wow! great rack! except.....
customer_reviews.text: this bike rack fits my wife's bike and mine perfectly and it's very easy and manageable. loading and unloading were simple and easy. I do not like how I have to periodically check the receiver attempt to see how tight it is. if they could somehow make a locking system it would go from 4.9 to 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Chase Smith

customer_reviews.title: excellent product; pricey, would be nice to have them make it lighter
customer_reviews.text: excellent product; pricey, would be nice to have them make it lighter; quality product. they thought of everything. lots of good details. fits well, loads easily. well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, solid rack.
customer_reviews.text: Solid rack, but way too expensive. Also, I wish that there was a way to switch over to a class I hitch without having to buy the whole rack all over again. I do like the anti-sway mount. That design is pure genius.
customer_reviews.author: citadelfox

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Gotta have it.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah if you’re tired of using your home vacuum or driving to the nearest QuickQuack then you need to get this. I love it because it’s high quality tons of very useful accessories easy to use and even drys as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Little in the large size but very heavy duty. Can fit up to four bikes with attachment. Bikes hardly move.
customer_reviews.author: Parham Ziapour

customer_reviews.title: Ebike beware!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike rack because it was rated for both bikes and fat tire bikes. I recently discovered that if your ebike has fenders then the arm will not secure properly. My brand new bike was dragged briefly but enough to do significant damage.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ensweiler

customer_reviews.title: Should have got one a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. While costly, it's so worth it. I've had this a few months now. Perfect upgrade from a cheaper platform rack that held the bike by the frame. I'll never go back to those types.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Thule quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack, solid mount and no wiggles. Quality build and adjustable for all bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A.Pouliot

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy durable solid rack
customer_reviews.text: Some assembly required and while not overly difficult, some people may have problems with it. Sturdy durable solid rack. I trust my $9000 S-Works road bike on the thing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Rack is awesome for holding the verity of bikes I have a fat bike with a 4.5 inch tire, a road bike, and it can handle my son’s 16 inch bike as well. I do wish the cables were longer to help secure the bikes, I would never use them as the only lock. Overall this is way better than my previous Yakama two-up rack.
customer_reviews.author: S. Potter

customer_reviews.title: It’s the only that can do ebikes
customer_reviews.text: But it’s quite awkward to assemble and big and heavy etc. Interferes with hatch.
customer_reviews.author: Aasmundus

customer_reviews.title: Solid but
customer_reviews.text: I had this one for almost a year now and the only issue that i have is the locking device. The plastic that holds the screw broke off. Every time i remove the rack the screw comes off
customer_reviews.author: Dr0pZ0n3

customer_reviews.title: watch when folding as it may hit the bumper
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are unnacceptable. The inside rack hits the bumper of my truck in the stow position no matter what ajustment i made to the slide mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rack, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack is exceptional. Easy to use and keeps bikes stable on all sorts of roads. Yeah, it’s not cheap but it worth every penny. A good value. Can’t go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in 15 minutes. Good sturdy unit. Locks provided for the hitch and both rack arms. The only reason I didnt give this a 5/5 was because the allen wrenches did not fit the bolts and screws. You will need 4 and 5 metric allens.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gage

customer_reviews.title: Well built, some assembly required.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but seems very well built with quality materials. I had to do some assembly, but it was not too difficult. I will update this review after first use.
customer_reviews.author: mike j

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack. Easy to install and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike rack! It is so easy to load your bikes! It was a tad difficult trying to put together with the locks. We had to you tube it, because we couldn't figure out the instructions fully, but overall, excellent bike rack!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Long

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Super easy to mount bikes to but I’m not sure the cable lock is the most secure thing. Easy to install on the car although it is heavy. Thule is top notch and has excellent customer service in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: tony britt

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit 27.5" wheels with tires over 4".
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Trek Farley with 27.5" wheels and anything over a 4" tire, DO NOT buy this product. The ratcheting will not fit over the front tire. So frigging annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to load bikes and very stable
customer_reviews.text: The bikes are easy put on the rack and take off. The bikes stay very stable. Rack is heavy, but I can put in on and take it off my car by myself. I am a short, small woman but can still manage it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Mermier

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money for the rear release
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Such an easy system and love the rear release. Better control of the bikes and lifting
customer_reviews.author: Steve - Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and sturdy. Quick and easy to use. You really can’t beat Thule products. Had a hitch mount hanging rack before getting this one and it held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this rack
customer_reviews.text: My second Thule hitch mounted bicycle rack. This is a wise investment for securing my beloved Trek Madone. I really like built in locks for securing my investment. Lord knows I cannot afford to replace a Trek Madone again for a good while.
customer_reviews.author: JAY S CHRISTOPHER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack! Very well built and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Amici

customer_reviews.title: You won’t find a better 2 banger hitch rack
customer_reviews.text: Solid rack. Super easy to load and lock bikes. Maiden voyage to Colo from Minnesota. Love the tilt feature
customer_reviews.author: Mhalvor

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: The rack arrived super quick and in great condition. It was very easy to assemble and even easier to install on my hitch. Have already used it to carry two bikes and I can't say enough about its sturdiness, ease of use, and my confidence in its ability to keep our bikes safe.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but keeps the bike so secure its worth it ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but keeps the bike so secure its worth it. I have now used with both road bikes and MTB's and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: I. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty rack
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty rack. Bikes ride nicely and securely on it. It is a little heavy for one to put on the car alone. But locks on and after tightened properly there is no wiggle or rattle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, secure, child bike friendly hitch rack
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for three things in a hitch rack: sturdiness, security (built in locks), and flexibility to fit a child's bike. This rack hit all three!
customer_reviews.author: John Sprehe

customer_reviews.title: Top of the heap Thule
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line, hands down! Heavy duty construction and will last a lifetime. Super sturdy when installed. No bouncing around in the hitch. Spend the money for the best and a piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack!
customer_reviews.text: I had the T2 rack before I bought this T2 Pro XT. Both are great racks but the Pro is much easier to use. Well worth the extra money. I love the zero tool install and the handle at the end of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lantz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack. Solid fit and the bikes are secure ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rack. Solid fit and the bikes are secure at all times.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Very good bike rack.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I had a little bit of trouble initially trying to put it together but once I unclogged my brain it was a breeze. It is easy to mount and secure. This is a very good bicycle rack.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but did great on a x-country and x-mountains trip. Bike was stable and it was comfortable having in on the back of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

product_meta.title: Thule T2 Pro XT 2 Bike Rack
product_meta.description: Easy to use, quick to setup and reliably secure. The Thule T2 Pro XT Hitch Rack with a 2" receiver comfortably holds up to 2 bikes with as much as a foot of space between them to eliminate interference. Attach it to your vehicle quickly with the tool-free AutoAttach system. Then, lock your bikes to the rack and secure it to the receiver with the integrated cable lock and lock knob. When not in use, the T2 Pro XT easily folds towards the vehicle. Load capacity is up to 120lbs, or up to 60lbs per bike.Features: Holds up to 2 bikes comfortably Easy to install and remove the rack with the tool-free AutoAttach system Carrier easily folds when not in use and tilts away from the vehicle for rear access Lock bikes to the rack and secure it to the receiver with the integrated cable lock and lock knob Eliminates bike interference by adjusting side to side to create spacing between each bike Load capacity of 120lbs
feature_bullets: Thule T2 Pro XT 2 - 1.25": Premium platform hitch bike rack for 2 bikes.
Dimensions: 54 x 15 x 43 inch | Folded dimensions: 54.7 x 22.5 x 33.8 inch
Tool free Auto Attach system makes it easy to install and remove
Secure bikes quickly without frame contact with the frame-free ratcheting arm. Distance between bikes :12.5 inch
Rack tilts down for rear of vehicle access and folds up when not in use
Ideal for carbon frames, mountain, downhill, ebikes and fat bikes as it fits 20 - 29” wheels and up to 5” tires without adapters
Max bike weight: 60 pound | Load capacity: 100 pound
Load capacity: 120 pounds. (60pound max per bike)
Dimensions: 54 x 15 x 43 inches; Folded dimensions: 54. 7 x 22. 5 x 33. 8 inches
DO NOT install on a trailer or other towed vehicle
